clinical_history: Thyroid swelling and suspected nodular disease.
technique: Real-time gray-scale and color Doppler imaging performed.
findings: No evidence of DVT; veins compressible with normal flow.
Common bile duct measures 23.25 mm, within normal limits.
Testes are ill-defined with normal vascularity.
Major vessels show enlarged waveform on Doppler.
Urinary bladder is well-defined, no intraluminal lesions.
Liver appears isoechoic with no focal lesions.
impression: Appearance concerning for possible malignancy—correlate clinically.
recommendations: Refer to specialist for further evaluation.
